cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 510 miles SE of New Orleans, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest across the central Gulf of Mexico toward the southeast Louisiana coast, then turning north into Mississippi and the lower Tennessee Valley.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana near the Mouth of the Mississippi River/New Orleans area

weather_observation.under_watch: Tropical Storm Watch; Storm Surge Watch
weather_observation.watch_coast: Mississippi/Alabama border to the Alabama/Florida border (TS Watch); Mobile Bay (Storm Surge Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of the Pearl River to the Mississippi/Alabama border (Tropical Storm Warning) and Intracoastal City LA to Pearl River mouth (Hurricane Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana eastward through Mississippi and coastal Alabama including Mobile Bay
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–50 kt) possible late Sunday night through Monday with a 52% cumulative probability for 34-kt winds and 12% for 50-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of inundation possible inside Mobile Bay if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain possible Monday into Tuesday, with locally higher amounts in bands.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain bands; dangerous surf and rip currents beginning late Saturday.
